name: Chapter 1: A Body in the Bay
summary: A six-part profile of Robert Durst, the scion of a wealthy New York real-estate family who has been accused of three murders over three decades, but never convicted, begins with the discovery of a dismembered body in Texas in 2001 and its possible connection to Durst. In 2012, Durst contacts director Andrew Jarecki about an interview.

name: Chapter 2: Poor Little Rich Boy
summary: Robert Durst discusses witnessing his mother's suicide when he was a child and his 1973 marriage to Kathleen McCormack, who disappeared in 1982.

name: Chapter 3: The Gangster's Daughter
summary: The case of Kathie Durst's 1982 disappearance is reopened in 2000, but Robert Durst's friend Susan Berman is murdered before police can interview her.

name: Chapter 4: The State of Texas vs. Robert Durst
summary: Robert Durst goes on trial in 2003 in Texas for the murder of his neighbor, Morris Black, but the defendant's legal team comes up with an unusual plea.

name: Chapter 5: Family Values
summary: The search for Kathie Durst continues 33 years after she disappeared in 1982.
